intro: Amblyanthus xanthomeson, commonly known as the yellow-flowered amblyanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its striking yellow petals and hairy, ovate leaves. Native to tropical regions, this plant thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oblong seeds. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
